author: stsp
msg: Rework the way svn add --parents creates missing parent directories,
fixing a potential problem with leaving the working copy locked upon
failure or cancellation.
* subversion/libsvn_client/add.c
(add_with_write_lock_baton): New member existing_parent_abspath.
(add): If existing_parent_abspath is set in the baton, create and add
any missing path components before adding the actual target.
(add_parent_dirs): Remove.
(find_existing_parent): New, based on previous. Finds the first
existing parent of the target to be added.
(svn_client_add4): Instead of directly creating missing parents with
questionable use of a working copy write lock, figure out the first
existing parent. Then lock that parent and call add() while holding
the lock to do the real work of adding the target and, if necessary,
its parents.
Suggested by: rhuijben
(in a comment removed by this commit)
